# Material Preparation

## May

- May 10th: Sakai sites and syllabi ready for review 
    -(instructors, email Nicole when ready)
- May 13th: approval/comments of Sakai sites and syllabi (Nicole)

--

## Before course starts

- Send syllabus to students:
  - 15 and 7 days before your session starts 
    - May 14th and 21st
- Verify students' placement
  - Deadline for uploading students' profile: 2nd day of classes (recommended tool: Assignments)
- Prepare your whole sakai site beforehand
  - Focus on grading during the session
- Make sure your internet connection and microphone are always good

---

# First week of classes 

- 2 orientation meetings (main + make-up)
  - Record this session
- Student agreement (on the syllabus)
- Student profile (2nd day due)
- No-show warnings (also for wiley plus)


--

# During the semester

- Weekly announcements for what they have to submit 
  - You can schedule them on sakai
- Show certain degree flexibility with their technological problems 
- Office Hours: 3 times a week, 1 hour (1 time on video, 2 times on chat)
- 48 hours to submit grades
    - Very important
- End: return textbooks to Jen

---

# General tips

- One-on-one meeting organizations:
  - Google doc
  - Doodle
  - Sakai: sign-up tool
  
--

- Put a picture and short bio of yourself in the homepage
  - Make sure students put pictures up for their VoiceThread

--

- Send messages to them with general comments
  - Weekly announcements 

--

- You cannot give access to the class to a specific student, they have to go through the office (Jerlene)

--

- Keep the same schedule with grading, emailing, and exams

---


# Workshop 

- Change dates on syllabus

--

- Check Sakai Sites 
  - Work on the templates, when done COPY and CREATE a new site

--

- Make a to-do list for yourself
